intro: Chordifex hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's cordifex, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in coastal and subalpine regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
